name: Decoration
description: This isn't a required chapter, but if you've ever wanted to spruce your home up we thought it might be worth investigating. This will guide you through some of the cosmetic things to help shape your world.

quests.name: Stairway to heaven
quests.description: So you may have noticed jumping up and down your mine can be troublesome, well there are other options, Namely... stairs!

tasks.longDescription: The slabs and stairs are halfblocks that you can also decorate your surroundings with. They are great for any number of things, but mostly for helping get around to higher locations without using all your food!

quests.name: Don't you Dye on me
quests.description: Another nifty and sometimes overlooked feature that you should use to add a bit of color to your location is the ability to dye a great many things.

tasks.longDescription: Most dye isn't hard to get a hold of, just grind up some flowers. But the 3 we're going to ask you get are a bit tougher. For Cactus you have to cook them, maybe kill a few squid and even dig in the core of the earth.

quests.name: Staining the deck
quests.description: Now that you have those dyes, what can you actually use them for? Well this will give you just a few examples that you might be interested in.

tasks.longDescription: Wool, Glass, these things are great for decorating and making the place a bit prettier!

quests.name: Fencing Lessons
quests.description: Fences really are these amazing things. they're great for decoration and in a pinch they can act as a quick wall!

tasks.description: The key to a quaint garden
tasks.longDescription: In this case we're going to show you all about fences AND gates. They're both pretty simple to craft. Keep in mind that both have a hitbox slightly higher then they are so monsters and your own farm animals can't simply jump over them.

quests.name: Take it for Granite
quests.description: Now you may not be used to the world having a color variety of rock underground, but you're going to have to. This can be great for decoration!

tasks.longDescription: There are at least a few different ways to get these kinds of rocks, but the most obvious is usually just to mine it straight up!

quests.name: Chisel'd into stone
quests.description: This is a tool that we think you will really begin to enjoy. The Chisel, a fantastic edition to any artisans tool set, the chisel lets you take regular looking blocks and make them look extraordinary.

tasks.longDescription: This chisel is a very useful decorative tool. It can take certain blocks and give them different designs. Simply right click the chisel while hodling it and then drag the block you want to see different designs for into the slot in the GUI

quests.name: Carpentry
quests.description: So now that you have submerged yourself int he world of decoration, perhaps it's time to get onto some of the most fun decorating yet! Carpentry

tasks.longDescription: This is a foundational little block, and first it may seem silly, a block that can take on the textures of other blocks, but trust us it will make more sense in a bit. To craft it, simply surround a plank of wood with 8 sticks.

Alright, technically it's a wedge slop, but tomato tomato am I right? The Wedge slope can be by craftin carpenters blocks with sticks, and by right clicking another block onto it you can give the carpenter block that blocks texture!
Each of these items ahs their own specific uniquness. The Garage door can go down severl blocks. The safe is tuned to blend in with the enviroment, and of course the bed. Mix, Match, and Play

quests.name: Potent Pottables
quests.description: Nothing quite makes the house more complete then the delicate scent of Flowers and Fragrence. Let's teach you the keys to making a simple way to put your flowers in a relatively safe place.

tasks.longDescription: Clay is a resource that you will find in various sections of the world, or if you can't you might try expirimenting with some barrels. But for the most part it's easy enough to find along river beds and the like! Just take a shovel to it.
Now you can throw that clay in a furnace and cook it up to make bricks. Bricks on their own aren't good for much (not even breaking windows) but they can be used to make pots!
With the pot you can put a great many things in there. From flowers to dead shrubs depending on how you want to show off your green thumb or lack there of.

quests.name: Carpenters tools
quests.description: It's hard to be the best carpenter unless you have all the tools for the job, don't you agree? Well so do we, and we'll be introducing you to just a few of them now!

tasks.longDescription: The hammer allows you to change the shape of the carpenters block after you've placed it (Rather then Shift scroll wheel while it's in your hand) and the chisel allows you to change the texture of the applied item.

quests.name: Brick Aestetic
quests.description: Bricks are wonderful blocks. Keep in mind they're slightly more blast resistant then normal stone. That makes it great as a substance to keep out creatures that would like to see you in pieces.

tasks.longDescription: Bricks are fairly simple to craft, simply take 4 of the bricks that you crafted for the pot. You can make all sorts of shapes with bricks too, give it a shot!

quests.name: Shelved away
quests.description: Sometimes things can get terribly cluttered. It's best to sort that all out when you can. Shelves can help you with that task!

tasks.longDescription: Shelves are great for placing just about anything upon It's a great way to decorate matters!
Book shelves are excellent for well... books. You can store all kinds of things here, but mostly just books. A great place to pull all those manuals you'll be making!
Potion shelves are a fanastic way to show off all the fancy magical glassware.

quests.name: Don't table this quest
quests.description: Sometimes you just want a nice table to put stuff on, well here is your chance to stop tableing that discussion.

tasks.longDescription: You'd be amazed what tables can do, moving their legs around whenever you place them close to each other, you  might even be able to put a table cloth on them

quests.name: Bambooozeld
quests.description: You may have noticed a strange substance growing out of the ground. No this isn't sugar cane, it's bamboo! Which is a wonderful construction material

tasks.longDescription: Bamboo can be found throughout the world, but it's most intriguing property is how it grows. To get bamboo shoots simply bonemeal a live and existing bamboo growth at it's base.
Fences, Blocks these should all be familiar, but the scaffolding can be knocked out at it's base block and will all come tumbling down. Wonderful for building quickly
Much like it's normal wooden counterpart, Bamboo can be cooked in a furnace to make handy dandy charcoal which has all the uses of regular charcoal.

quests.name: A dose of nature.
quests.description: Nature is a strang thing, but it is colorful woulnd't you say? Head out into the world and get a breath of fresh air, collect some new cool saplings

tasks.longDescription: Saplings are the fruit of life. These are a few of the more intersting trees you might find int he woods. Cut a few down to gather their saplings!
Try to use the fancy wood you've collected surely to make a crafting table.

quests.name: I saw that coming
quests.description: Sometimes the blocks you have to work with are simply to big, so it's really best to cut it down to size.

tasks.longDescription: A bit of flint and some other ingredients and I bet you'll be able to make this little Stone Saw
Once you have the saw it's simple enough to saw an oak block. Simply put the Saw above block you wish to saw in a crafitng swear. It will take a bit of durability from the saw.

quests.name: You've been framed
quests.description: Feeling a bit under pressure? Well there's no time for that! We have pretty things to make, and sometimes you want to make shelves at of something OTHER then wood

tasks.longDescription: To start this party, we're going to need something called a framing saw! It's a simple enough tool
Once you've made the saw simply place it with a normal wood plank to cut it up into sheets. Then place those sheets with the saw to cut them into boards.

Now that we've got that out of the way we can make the final components. Framed versions of almost all of the household furniture exist, expirment to find out exactly which and then to apply the texture simply put the framed item and the block whose texture you wish to apply into the furniture paneler!

quests.name: There's your sign!
quests.description: Sometimes it's simply nice ot mark the things around you so you can know what in the world is where right? Well we agree, and these are some great items to help with that quest.

tasks.longDescription: Signs are great ways to write down a little bit of text. Simply combining a stick with 6 planks and you can make your very own signs and hang them just about anywhere that your heart desires. Remember that Shift Right Clicking will put it on sufraces you normally wouldn't be able to!

Another great item to have around the hosue is the item frame. By putting leather at the center of several sticks you can make your very own Item frames, which are fantastic for giving you a place to put an item instead of text. Try them out around your base!

quests.name: A little Demonstration
quests.description: Now that you have your chisel we want you to try it out on a few different blocks. Just to get an idea of what exactly it changes.

tasks.longDescription: We've asked you to go and get a few samplings of the various things you can chisel into place. With a little time and effort they shouldn't be to hard to find. We even gave you the ingredients for 1 already!

quests.name: Fancy Doors
quests.description: Sure a wooden door is nice, but what about even fancier doors? I bet those would be even nicer right? Well there's quite a few out there for you to try!

tasks.longDescription: These are unique doors that have their own way of opening. Build a few an expiriment with them to see which ones you like!

Sometimes it can be really bothersome to have to go through all the hoops and ladders to make your door open just the right way, well what if you just want it to open if a player is near. The player sensor is great for that, emitting a redstone signal ONLY when players are around

quests.name: Factor it in!
quests.description: There's a few more blocks that you're probalby not familiar with that you can actually craft and add to your base that are pretty cool! You should definately check them and all their chiseled varities out.

tasks.longDescription: You'll find concrete by cooking up some gravel in a furnace, it might even be a little faster to travel on. And you'll find factory blocks by crafting Iron and stone together for the ultimate in classy futuaristic apperances.

quests.name: On Display
quests.description: So you've had a way to display blocks, what about Fluids? Ever wanted lava without having to deal with the side effects of Lava? Try the Fluid display!

tasks.longDescription: With a bit of glass panes and a glass bottle, you too can make your very own fluid display. You can simply right click with a fluid and the fluid display will be filled!

quests.name: Carpet puncher
quests.description: Did you know you can make carpets? Well you can. They're great for covering the floor and making it look fanicer then it actually is. Carpets are also fantastic ways to cause dust allergies.

tasks.longDescription: Carpet's aren't too hard to make. Simply take two blocks of a wool of the color you want and you should be able to make some carpet with it.

quests.name: Snow Way
quests.description: Snow is a funny thing. Like carpet it starts off small but can build up over time if you let it. But did you know you can use it to even make a snow golem? Did you want to give it a shot?

tasks.longDescription: So the basics of this are all fairly simple. You just need a bit of snow and some jack-o-lanters. For the snow combine 4 snowballs, and for the jack-o-lantern well that's covered elsewhere. But you put two snow blocks on top of each other and then a Jack-o-Lantern on top of that and wa la, your very own Frosty

quests.name: Paint me like one of your...
quests.description: Tired of clicking a painting 7,000 times just to get the right one? Well so is the rest of the world so they invented a device to deal with just that problem.

tasks.longDescription: It might seem a bit expensive, but I promise you that Iron is TOTALLY worth the cost. Maybe... Well don't quote us on that. It is very useful though if you like paintings.

The canvas is what you actually put in the machine to make pretty things so to speak. Simply craft the canvas and then shove it in the painting press. Then you can put it in the very classy frames around your house!

quests.name: Everyone loves glasses
quests.description: So you have all these shelves, but what if sometimes you want the shelves and can't remember what you put on them? Well that is what reading glasses are for!

tasks.longDescription: And you really can go anywhere. But for today's lecture you can put these on and view just about anything on your shelves, books, potions, items, you name it. It even has some uses when you start getting into the printing press.

quests.name: Gutenberg or Bi Sheng?
quests.description: Have you ever had one book that you /really/ like but you want to give a copy to a friend, and that friend has a bad habit of falling in lava and dying terribly and losing your book so you need an extra copy? Well fret no more!

tasks.longDescription: The first tool you need is a typesetting tool. For it you're going to need to make some typesetting chases which are simple enough to make. To use the typesetting tool simply put the chase at the back, a written book (or even enchanted) in the front and then a book to copy it to... but that's going to go somewhere else!

Right clicking the typesetting tool when you have a Printing Chase and a book will get you a press. Put the press and some Ink into a Printing press along with a fresh empty book and you can transfer it to a new book. Expiriment and play!

quests.name: 5 Dollar foot long
quests.description: If you're like us there are times that you want to build a place but you need a way to make sure that you're using the proper number of blocks and spacing. Counting off in your head is just no good

tasks.longDescription: Crafted with 4 Iron around a tape measure reel (which is just 8 string around a single yellow dye). The Tape measure can be used by simply right clicking in your world to set a marker, it will then display the distance between you and that marker. Great for laying out bases!

quests.name: Barrels of Fun
quests.description: So you may not always want to go deep diving for clay every time you need it, well there are other ways to get ahold of htis lovely substance.

tasks.longDescription: Barrels are simple enough to create, Simply a slab and some wood will make you a simple enough barrel. You can expiriment with it (Maybe throw some leaves in there) Or even some water and Dust... all kinds of interesting combintations.

quests.name: Vanishing Act
quests.description: Redstone and Ender eyes are strange things, but they can help you build some rather fancy. Meet the vanishing blocks.

tasks.longDescription: Like carpenters blocks, these blocks can take on the texture of other block, but unlike carpenter blocks when you expose it to redstone it will temporarily dissapear. Expirment with the upgraded versions to see how they interact differently!

quests.name: Kentucky Bluegrass
quests.description: Grass is wonderful, it adds a real natural feel to your base, but what if we told you that you can make your own grass? That's right, we be bet you'd be intersted in that wouldn't you?

tasks.longDescription: Made by mixing dirt blocks with special ingedients, each of these can turn an otherwise dull garden into a spectacular one. Mix and match to find out what you like.

quests.name: Standing Up
quests.description: There are times that you have more armor then you know what to do with and you'd like a place to put it all. Well it's time to learn about the armor stands that exist for you and your friends!

tasks.longDescription: Made simply by having 3 stone slabs across the botom and 2 Iron Bars in the center like an upside down T, this armor stand can hold one full set of armor for you to display for all to see.

There's not just armor for you, there can also be armor for your brave stallion. Made in a similar fashion to the armor stand, the horse armor provides a way for you to show off that stunning set of armor you find out in the world.
